newsitem.title: NORWAY: FORECAST - Nera 1996 pre-tax seen up 6.5 pct.
newsitem.headline: FORECAST - Nera 1996 pre-tax seen up 6.5 pct.

text.p: Norwegian telecommunications group Nera ASA is expected to post full-year 1996 pre-tax profits of 164 million crowns, a Reuter survey of of seven analysts showed.
The average estimate is an increase of 6.5 percent on the group's 1995 pre-tax result of 154 million crowns.
Four of the analysts recommended a buy on the stock, two said hold and one declined to provide a recommendation.

All of the analysts said they expected Nera to show future growth in the world market, which itself was forecast to grow strongly. The two with hold recommendations said, however, that the company's share was fairly highly priced at current levels.
Nera closed at 315 crowns on Tuesday, 16 percent up on the year low so far of 315 crowns set on January 2.

"Globalisation in the telecommunications market makes me see great potential for Nera. Average forecasts expect Nera's market on a world basis to grown by about 20 percent in 1997," said one of the analysts.
Another more cautious analyst said: "In industries such as digitalisation prices often have a tendency to fall fast and heavily."
Several of the analysts put emphasis on Nera's new WorldPhone satellite telephone.
"Development for WorldPhone appears very positive. I think the group will sell more than they have forecast," said one analyst.
Nera is due to release full-year 1996 results on February 4. Following lists analysts' expectations.
